paragraphs.text: Let's see Turkey for what it really is.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: How times have changed
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In the 18th century, Russian meddling in Crimea and Syria would have likely led to war with Turkey
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Today, Russia's actions in the former Ottoman world mean a state visit for Russian President Vladimir Putin, discounted natural gas, and lucrative trade deals
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Turkey's recent coziness with Russia, and its reluctance to take on the ISIL, have left many politicians in the West confused and frustrated
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: However
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: to understand Turkish foreign policy one must first look at US and European foreign policy
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The lack of any coherent US-Middle East policy has made Turkey reluctant to respond to ISIL in any meaningful way
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: US President Barack Obama's disinterest in the region began with his hell-bent desire to remove all US forces from Iraq, no matter what the security situation was like
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: As far as Ankara was concerned, the US left behind unfinished business in Iraq
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Next came the US response to the so-called Arab Spring
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: which amounted to telling regional autocrats that they had to go
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: when they did not leave, the US failed to do anything about it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Perhaps the biggest failure of Obama's Middle East policy was drawing a "red line", and then failing to enforce it when Bashar al-Assad used chemical weapons against his own people
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Pushing Turkey away
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Since Turkey does not believe the US will see through to the completion of its mission to take on ISIL and force Assad out of power
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: understandably, Ankara has been reluctant to come on board
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: As far as Ankara is concerned, US creditability in the Middle East is bankrupt
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is not just US foreign policy pushing Turkey away from the West
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This week, the EU's new foreign policy chief, Federica Mogherini, visited Ankara and told a group of journalists that the EU's "top priority will be Turkey's EU accession process"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: After years of delays by Brussels, it is not likely anyone in Turkey will believe these words
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: - nor should they
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Europe's empty promises of EU membership, and its weak response over Russia's invasion of Ukraine, has forced Turkey to hedge its bets that closer ties with Moscow are preferable to those with Brussels
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Making a bad situation worse is the degree of European xenophobia lurking inside the debate around Turkish membership of the EU
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Make no mistake
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Turkey's President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has not been the easiest leader for the West to work with
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Apart from some of his more ridiculous, but harmless statements -"Muslim sailors reached the American continent 314 years before Columbus, in 1178" - many in the West have been put off by his crackdown on political dissent, limitations on press freedom, and his drive to bring a more conservative brand of Islam into what is still a largely secular society
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Leaders in the West would be wise not to dismiss Turkey altogether because of Erdogan's ironfisted leadership style
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Turkey is a parliamentary democracy
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: as the president, Erdogan derives his extensive powers because his Justice and Development Party (AKP) currently controls parliament
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Without an AKP majority in parliament, the centre of power in Turkish politics is likely to shift back to the prime minister's office
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In June, Turkey will hold its next parliamentary elections
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: - and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: if
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the elections are anything like Turkey's 2014 presidential elections
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: the race will be close
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the AKP does not get a majority, or if they have to form a coalition
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Erdogan's power and influence will be significantly curtailed
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Turkey is situated in a dangerous neighbourhood
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It has land borders with Syria, Iraq, and Iran
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: Its border with Armenia is closed
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: A recent investigation uncovered a terror organisation operating inside Turkey with links to Iran's Revolutionary Guard Corps
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: ISIL controls huge swaths of land along the Turkish border with Syria and Iran
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The threat from Assad is so great that NATO currently provides air defence units to protect Turkish airspace
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: It is clear that foreign policy decisions taken by the US and Europe have left Turkey feeling exposed
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Short-sighted leaders in the West need to open their eyes and see Turkey for what it really is: a valued NATO partner, a secular state (at least for now) bridging Europe and the Islamic world, a developing economy and a major player in the energy market
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: What a tragedy it would be if broken promises from Europe, combined with a lack of US leadership and strategy in the Middle East, results in a Turkey that becomes more fundamentalist, anti-western, and pro- Russian
paragraphs.label: assumption
